text: U.S. District Judge Donovan Frank on Tuesday sentenced Kyrees Darius Johnson, 22, of Minneapolis, to nearly eight years in prison to wrap up the case — by far the longest prison term given to any of the three charged and owing to Johnson’s lengthier criminal record.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: According to court records, an investigator from the Central Minnesota Violent Offender Task Force notified the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives in March 2023 of a Snapchat group called “BLICCS&STICCS3″ that was suspected of being used to help traffic machine guns, other firearms and illicit drugs in the Twin Cities and outside the metro.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Frank sentenced Wesley to 14 months in prison last week and imposed a two-year sentence on Drayton in April.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Frank sentenced Wesley to 14 months in prison last week and imposed a two-year sentence on Drayton in April.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Frank sentenced Wesley to 14 months in prison last week and imposed a two-year sentence on Drayton in April.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: The three were first charged in September 2023 and each pleaded guilty to one count of unlawful possession of machine guns.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: The three were first charged in September 2023 and each pleaded guilty to one count of unlawful possession of machine guns.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: During one of the deals, Wesley arranged for undercover officers to meet Drayton to buy a 3D-printed drop-in machinegun conversion device for an AR-style rifle for $550.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Johnson, who was sentenced this week, now needs a wheelchair since being shot 14 times during what prosecutors alleged to be an attempted carjacking in August 2023.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Johnson’s attorney, Catherine Turner, described the altercation as a violent dispute between Johnson and another man linked to Johnson’s occasional girlfriend.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Turner said Johnson first procured a gun after returning home from a prior prison stint for assault and amid exposure to “sketchy strangers” in his girlfriend’s life and tumult surrounding his family.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Wesley had no prior convictions but did have two pending felony cases involving his possession of a ghost gun and drugs.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Drayton had been convicted of two gross misdemeanors: property damage in 2021 after pursuing a victim in his vehicle and ramming it twice and in 2022 for possessing a loaded gun without a permit.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Assistant U.S. Attorney Ruth Shnider countered in her own arguments to Frank that Johnson’s Snapchat posts were “not the actions of a young man merely curious about guns or concerned for his personal safety.”

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: Assistant U.S. Attorney Ruth Shnider countered in her own arguments to Frank that Johnson’s Snapchat posts were “not the actions of a young man merely curious about guns or concerned for his personal safety.”

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: “Johnson was a trafficker — he chose to support himself by selling guns and drugs — plain and simple,” Shnider wrote.

meta.headline: Prison for all 3 men whose Snapchat gun ring sold ‘switches,’ ghost guns around the Twin Cities

text: A vote on the Democratic Party’s presidential nominee won’t happen before Aug. 1, according to a letter sent by Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, who serves as co-chair of the Democratic National Convention’s rules committee.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: The letter, which was sent to members of the rules committee Wednesday, has quieted concerns from some Democrats that the party might try to do a virtual roll call to nominate President Joe Biden in late July despite concerns post-debate about his ability to beat former President Donald Trump.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: The letter, signed by Walz, said he and co-chair Leah Daughtry confirmed with the Democratic National Committee that there will be no “rushed” voting for the nomination before August, but voting will happen before the convention convenes in Chicago on Aug. 19.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: The letter, signed by Walz, said he and co-chair Leah Daughtry confirmed with the Democratic National Committee that there will be no “rushed” voting for the nomination before August, but voting will happen before the convention convenes in Chicago on Aug. 19.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: Democrats have been planning the virtual roll call vote in the first week of August to make sure Biden meets a deadline to appear on the ballot in Ohio.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: Axios reported that House Democrats had planned to send a letter to the Democratic National Committee opposing an early virtual roll call vote to nominate Biden.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: Biden won the needed delegates in primary elections and has pledged to stay in the race, but a growing number of donors and elected Democrats are publicly airing concerns or calling for him to step aside, including Minnesota DFL U.S. Rep. Angie Craig, who is running in a swing district.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: Walz’s role as a Biden campaign surrogate and chair of the Democratic Governors Association has put him at the center of conversations about what happens next.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August

text: He recently organized a meeting between Biden and Democratic governors at the White House following the debate, and he’s part of a small group of top Democrats who could help choose a nominee if Biden drops out after the August convention.

meta.headline: Letter signed by Walz quiets concerns about push to nominate President Biden before August
